title: Part a. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Writing an equation to solve for the speed when the dart is at its maximum height

v = vx = v0 (cos θ )

v = (10 m/s)(cos30º)

1 point: For a correct answer
v = 8.7 m/s
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Writing an equation to solve for the speed when the dart is at its maximum height

v = vx = v0 (cos θ )

v = (10 m/s)(cos30º)

1 point: For a correct answer
v = 8.7 m/s

The student response earns all of the following points:

Writing an equation to solve for the speed when the dart is at its maximum height

v = vx = v0 (cos θ )

v = (10 m/s)(cos30º)

1 point: For a correct answer
v = 8.7 m/s

title: Part b. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

Writing an equation to solve for time using motion in the vertical direction

vy = vy0 + ayt

0 = (10 m/s)(sin 30) + (–9.8 m/s2 )t

1 point: for a correct value for the time

t = 0.51 s (or t = 0.50 s if using g = 10 m/s2 )

1 point: For substituting into an equation for the horizontal motion consistent with the speed from part a., or for determining the correct answer
x = vxt

x = (8.7 m/s)(0.51 s)

x = 4.4 m

title: Part c. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For a correct expression of conservation of momentum
Pi = Pf

1 point: For a correct expression that represents a totally inelastic collision between the dart and the block
m1v1i = (m1 + m2 )vf

(0.020 kg)(8.66 m/s) = (0.020 kg + 0.10 kg)vf

1 point: For an answer consistent with the speed from part a. and correct mass substitutions
v = 1.4 m/s

title: Part f. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (i. 2 points; ii. 2 points)

i. 2 points

1 point: For selecting “Increase”
1 point: For a correct justification of the larger angle for the block-dart system

Example: A more massive dart would cause the speed after the collision with the block to increase. A greater speed after the collision would cause the block to reach a greater height and thus the angle θ would increase.

ii. 2 points

1 point: For selecting “Stay the same”

1 point: For a correct justification

Example: A more massive dart would not affect the period of the pendulum. Only changing the length of the string would change the period.

Note: If the student correctly points out the changes to the simple pendulum could be outside the small angle approximation, then the student’s entire answer will be considered (both check box and justification are consistent and physically correct).
